The entities in the paragraph that do not clearly refer to "Material name" are:

* "23.8 °" (this is a value, not a material name)
* "26.6 °" (this is a value, not a material name)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak at 2θ = 21.4 ° and two weak peaks at 23.8 ° and 26.6 ° for the as-prepared thin film.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 2° |
| 23.8° |
| 26.6° |
| 21.4° |

In this table, the "Property Value" column lists the values mentioned in the paragraph for each of the properties:

* 2°: the angle at which PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak
* 23.8°: the angle at which PzNDTDTBT showed one of the weak peaks
* 26.6°: the angle at which PzNDTDTBT showed another weak peak
* 21.4°: the angle at which PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak.
